item.title: New Simple Program
item.dc:creator: @Ags_Rush Ags Rush
item.description:
@Ags_Rush wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:6, topic:422598”][quote author=Ags Rush link=topic=525261.msg3823838#msg3823838 date=1322004070]

Also, why

total = cost;

?

Why not just print out cost?

I’m fairly new at programming, this is the way I learned how to do it.
[/quote]
Fair enough.

I’m just saying, it seems pointless to assign two variables in the place of one.
It’s basically like doing this:

int w, x, y, z;
z = 1;
x = z+1;
y = x;

It’s like, fluff. Memory waste.[/quote]

So just fuck the whole total thing and put price is " + price + ".");

Another question, when writing a swing component, using the JOptionPane package, what do i replace with dataIn.readLine? Also is it sendInputMessageDialog or setInputMessageDialog?

item.title: New Simple Program
item.dc:creator: @Ags_Rush Ags Rush
item.description:
@Ags_Rush wrote:

[code]/* Gas Mileage Calculator */

import java.io.*;

public class GasMileage {

public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {

	/* Declare and Construct Variables */
	String distance, price, gas;
	int miles, dollars, gallons;
	double fuel, cost, total;
	BufferedReader dataIn= new BufferedReader (new InputStreamReader(System.in));

	/* Print Prompts and get Input */
	System.out.println("\tZach's Gas Mileage Calculator");
	System.out.println();
	System.out.println("\t\tEnter your total distance you are traveling");
	distance = dataIn.readLine();
	miles = Integer.parseInt(distance);
	System.out.println("\t\tEnter the price of gas to the gallon");
	price = dataIn.readLine();
	dollars = Integer.parseInt(distance);
	System.out.println("\t\tEnter your car's gallons to the mile ratio");
	gas = dataIn.readLine();
	gallons = Integer.parseInt(gas);

	/* Calculations */
	fuel = miles / gallons;
	cost = fuel * dollars;
	total = cost;

	/* Output */
	System.out.println();
	System.out.println("\tThe cost of gas you will need for this trip is " + total + ".");
	System.out.println();
}

}[/code]

Revised. I had a few errors. I used notepad to write this. I just finished downloading textpad though.

Read full topic
